intro: Pleuteron breynia, commonly known as the Breynia tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub that can grow up to 6 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. Its flowers are small and typically yellow or greenish-yellow, appearing in clusters. The tree is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates.
